result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Elton Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample & pay surcharges. *Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  *Bond on file of $300.00 to be applied and the balance due is to be paid while on probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Copy of JOC taken to MASO even though not stated on JOC.  smr

Defendant Robert Elton Larson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR2121 & 15TR2122 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  15TR2121 & 15TR2122 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea. 
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. 

 BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.  15TR2121 & 15TR2122 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
5 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before October 1, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 0 days
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
bond to be applied; balance to be paid while on probation
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Robert Elton Larson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR2121, 15TR2122 tracking with 16CM6:

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on May 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Elton Larson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant did an application last week so Discovery has not been asked for yet.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
